    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The clash between Atlético Madrid and Barcelona was set to be a highly anticipated encounter, and it lived up to the expectations with thrilling moments from the very beginning. Atlético Madrid kicked off proceedings at the Estadio Wanda Metropolitano, taking control of the ball and pressing forward energetically in the opening minutes.

At just under three minutes, Atlético had their first attempt at goal, but it sailed wide. Their determination to press high continued immediately as they earned a corner kick a minute later, only to see the resulting shot again miss the target. Barcelona quickly cleared their lines, indicating their intent to stabilize early and deny Atlético any early opportunities to capitalize.

Barcelona saw the pattern of the game quickly evolve into a midfield battleground, punctuated by a series of fouls. Atlético were tireless in their physical approach, aiming to disrupt Barcelona's well-known rhythm. By the eighth minute, fouls by Atlético had given Barcelona opportunities through indirect free-kicks. However, the game briefly stuttered with throw-ins and the ball occasionally drifting out of play, breaking the continuity both teams desired.

By the quarter-hour mark, Atlético Madrid had their best chances of the first half within quick succession. Gabi unleashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box aiming straight at the goal, only to be thwarted by Marc-Andre ter Stegen's fine save. Moments later, Antoine Griezmann fired a shot that was blocked at the last second by the Barcelona defense, denying Atlético another promising attempt.

The middle segment of the half saw Barcelona gradually reclaim possession and probe into Atlético's half. Lionel Messi was at the forefront, orchestrating their attacks through deft passes and penetrating dribbles. A brief highlight occurred in the 28th minute, with Messi shooting low, only for Jan Oblak to make a solid save, preventing any breakthrough.

Atlético continued to surge forward with intensity and an increasing number of set-piece opportunities. Koke, pivotal for Atlético, sent dangerous crosses from corners, but each time ter Stegen or the Barcelona defense managed to neutralize the threat. The rhythm of the game involved frequent interruptions from fouls and indirect free-kicks made necessary by Atlético's aggressive pressing.

A critical moment for Barcelona came just before the half-hour mark when Messi delivered a free-kick from the edge of the box, striking it with precision towards the goal's underside. Oblak's brilliant save kept the score level, emphasizing the evening's duel between Atlético’s physicality and Barcelona’s technical finesse.

The end of the first half was characterized by continuous back-and-forth efforts. Both teams had spells led by industrious midfield play, but neither could break the deadlock. Barcelona ended the first half on an offensive flurry but failed to convert several corner opportunities as Atlético's resilience held firm.

The second half began with Barcelona resuming play, hinting at an immediate intention to shift the offensive gears. Atlético's Kevin Gameiro found himself flagged for offside within the first minute, a missed opportunity for them to push ahead early. Barcelona soon faced a series of stoppages due to fouls and throw-ins as Atlético maintained their physical edge.

Atletico seemed to capitalize more on counter-attack opportunities, with Filipe Luis and others sending crosses into the penalty area only to see Barcelona's defense step up effectively each time. The game opened up when Griezmann managed to create space within the box in the 51st minute, forcing another key save from ter Stegen.

The realization of the game’s increasingly physical nature resulted in yellow cards, with Sergio Busquets and Saul receiving bookings for gritty tackles by the hour mark. One of the pivotal moments came with Diego Godin’s near-miss header from a corner which narrowly went over the bar; a clear sign of Atlético’s continuing aerial threat.

Barcelona launched another series of attacks by pressing high and retaining possession effectively. Neymar and Suarez combined well, but Oblak remained resolute, grabbing a floated cross aimed for an onrushing Suarez in the 64th minute.

Just after mid-hour mark in the second half, Barcelona's persistence paid off. Following a corner from Neymar and subsequent defensive scrambles, Luis Suarez’s initial headed effort missed, but Rafinha pounced on the rebound, drilling it low inside the left post to bring the visitors ahead at 1-0, breaking the long-standing deadlock.

Atlético responded with urgency immediately on restart and were quickly awarded opportunities. A substitution saw Fernando Torres coming on for Carrasco, adjusting their forward setup in search of an equalizer. Within a few minutes, their persistence found its reward. Koke delivered an exceptional free-kick into the box, where Diego Godin managed an expertly timed run and headed the ball into the net, leveling the score at 1-1 in the 70th minute.

The game entered a critical phase with tactical changes including Barcelona introducing Ivan Rakitic for Andres Iniesta and Atlético bringing on Angel Correa for Gameiro. The match became increasingly intense with numerous fouls indicating the teams' desperate attempts to gain control, and several more yellow cards were issued including to Gabi and Correa.

Barcelona faced an injury setback as Jeremy Mathieu, needing medical treatment, was unable to continue, with Lucas Digne substituting in his place. The final passages of play saw frantic exchanges, capped by Lionel Messi delivering a game-changing moment.

As the end of regulation loomed, Messi found space within Atlético's crowded box, first rising to meet a cross with a header but failing to direct it on target. His resilience bore fruit, though, as he capitalized on a rebound to stab the ball home, ensuring Barcelona reclaimed their lead at 2-1.

Atlético's attempts to claw back were persistent with pressure applied till the final minutes. Despite their efforts, Barcelona managed to maintain possession and wind down the clock, stifling Atlético's last-ditch attempts. The referee's final whistle brought an end to a thrilling contest, with Barcelona emerging victorious 2-1, a result carved out through tenacity, tactical adjustments, and seizing critical opportunities when they mattered the most.
